◆ SDL_LockTexture()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_LockTexture ( SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_Rect * rect,
void ** pixels,
int * pitch )
extern

Lock a portion of the texture for write-only pixel access.

As an optimization, the pixels made available for editing don't necessarily contain the old texture data. This is a write-only operation, and if you need to keep a copy of the texture data you should do that at the application level.

You must use SDL_UnlockTexture() to unlock the pixels and apply any changes.

Parameters
texturethe texture to lock for access, which was created with SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING.
rectan SDL_Rect structure representing the area to lock for access; NULL to lock the entire texture.
pixelsthis is filled in with a pointer to the locked pixels, appropriately offset by the locked area.
pitchthis is filled in with the pitch of the locked pixels; the pitch is the length of one row in bytes.
Returns
true on success or false if the texture is not valid or was not created with SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_LockTextureToSurface
SDL_UnlockTexture
2432{
2433 SDL_Rect full_rect;
2434
2435 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
2436
2437 if (texture->access != SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING) {
2438 return SDL_SetError("SDL_LockTexture(): texture must be streaming");
2439 }
2440
2441 if (!rect) {
2442 full_rect.x = 0;
2443 full_rect.y = 0;
2444 full_rect.w = texture->w;
2445 full_rect.h = texture->h;
2446 rect = &full_rect;
2447 }
2448
2449#ifdef SDL_HAVE_YUV
2450 if (texture->yuv) {
2451 if (!FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded(texture)) {
2452 return false;
2453 }
2454 return SDL_LockTextureYUV(texture, rect, pixels, pitch);
2455 } else
2456#endif
2457 if (texture->native) {
2458 // Calls a real SDL_LockTexture/SDL_UnlockTexture on unlock, flushing then.
2459 return SDL_LockTextureNative(texture, rect, pixels, pitch);
2460 } else {
2461 SDL_Renderer *renderer = texture->renderer;
2462 if (!FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded(texture)) {
2463 return false;
2464 }
2465 return renderer->LockTexture(renderer, texture, rect, pixels, pitch);
2466 }
2467}
FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded
static bool FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded(SDL_Texture *texture)
Definition SDL_render.c:340
SDL_LockTextureNative
static bool SDL_LockTextureNative(SDL_Texture *texture, const SDL_Rect *rect, void **pixels, int *pitch)
Definition SDL_render.c:2420
SDL_Renderer::LockTexture
bool(* LockTexture)(SDL_Renderer *renderer, SDL_Texture *texture, const SDL_Rect *rect, void **pixels, int *pitch)
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:250

References SDL_Texture::access, CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC, FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded(), SDL_Rect::h, SDL_Texture::h, SDL_Renderer::LockTexture, SDL_Texture::native, SDL_Texture::renderer, SDL_LockTextureNative(), SDL_SetError(), SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING, SDL_Rect::w, SDL_Texture::w, SDL_Rect::x, SDL_Rect::y, and SDL_Texture::yuv.

◆ SDL_LockTextureToSurface()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_LockTextureToSurface ( SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_Rect * rect,
SDL_Surface ** surface )
extern

Lock a portion of the texture for write-only pixel access, and expose it as a SDL surface.

Besides providing an SDL_Surface instead of raw pixel data, this function operates like SDL_LockTexture.

As an optimization, the pixels made available for editing don't necessarily contain the old texture data. This is a write-only operation, and if you need to keep a copy of the texture data you should do that at the application level.

You must use SDL_UnlockTexture() to unlock the pixels and apply any changes.

The returned surface is freed internally after calling SDL_UnlockTexture() or SDL_DestroyTexture(). The caller should not free it.

Parameters
texturethe texture to lock for access, which must be created with SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING.
recta pointer to the rectangle to lock for access. If the rect is NULL, the entire texture will be locked.
surfacea pointer to an SDL surface of size rect. Don't assume any specific pixel content.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_LockTexture
SDL_UnlockTexture
2470{
2471 SDL_Rect real_rect;
2472 void *pixels = NULL;
2473 int pitch = 0; // fix static analysis
2474
2475 if (!texture || !surface) {
2476 return false;
2477 }
2478
2479 real_rect.x = 0;
2480 real_rect.y = 0;
2481 real_rect.w = texture->w;
2482 real_rect.h = texture->h;
2483 if (rect) {
2484 SDL_GetRectIntersection(rect, &real_rect, &real_rect);
2485 }
2486
2487 if (!SDL_LockTexture(texture, &real_rect, &pixels, &pitch)) {
2488 return false;
2489 }
2490
2491 texture->locked_surface = SDL_CreateSurfaceFrom(real_rect.w, real_rect.h, texture->format, pixels, pitch);
2492 if (!texture->locked_surface) {
2493 SDL_UnlockTexture(texture);
2494 return false;
2495 }
2496
2497 *surface = texture->locked_surface;
2498 return true;
2499}
SDL_UnlockTexture
void SDL_UnlockTexture(SDL_Texture *texture)
Definition SDL_render.c:2543
SDL_LockTexture
bool SDL_LockTexture(SDL_Texture *texture, const SDL_Rect *rect, void **pixels, int *pitch)
Definition SDL_render.c:2431
SDL_CreateSurfaceFrom
SDL_DECLSPEC SDL_Surface *SDLCALL SDL_CreateSurfaceFrom(int width, int height, SDL_PixelFormat format, void *pixels, int pitch)
Definition SDL_surface.c:246
SDL_Texture::locked_surface
SDL_Surface * locked_surface
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:101

References SDL_Texture::format, SDL_Rect::h, SDL_Texture::h, SDL_Texture::locked_surface, NULL, SDL_CreateSurfaceFrom(), SDL_GetRectIntersection(), SDL_LockTexture(), SDL_UnlockTexture(), SDL_Rect::w, SDL_Texture::w, SDL_Rect::x, and SDL_Rect::y.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_RenderClear()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderClear ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
extern

Clear the current rendering target with the drawing color.

This function clears the entire rendering target, ignoring the viewport and the clip rectangle. Note, that clearing will also set/fill all pixels of the rendering target to current renderer draw color, so make sure to invoke SDL_SetRenderDrawColor() when needed.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetRenderDrawColor

3400}

◆ SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderCoordinatesFromWindow ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
float window_x,
float window_y,
float * x,
float * y )
extern

Get a point in render coordinates when given a point in window coordinates.

This takes into account several states:

  • The window dimensions.
  • The logical presentation settings (SDL_SetRenderLogicalPresentation)
  • The scale (SDL_SetRenderScale)
  • The viewport (SDL_SetRenderViewport)
Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
window_xthe x coordinate in window coordinates.
window_ythe y coordinate in window coordinates.
xa pointer filled with the x coordinate in render coordinates.
ya pointer filled with the y coordinate in render coordinates.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetRenderLogicalPresentation
SDL_SetRenderScale
2912{
2913 float render_x, render_y;
2914
2915 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
2916
2917 // Convert from window coordinates to pixels within the window
2918 render_x = window_x * renderer->dpi_scale.x;
2919 render_y = window_y * renderer->dpi_scale.y;
2920
2921 // Convert from pixels within the window to pixels within the view
2922 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = &renderer->main_view;
2923 if (view->logical_presentation_mode != SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_DISABLED) {
2924 const SDL_FRect *src = &view->logical_src_rect;
2925 const SDL_FRect *dst = &view->logical_dst_rect;
2926 render_x = ((render_x - dst->x) * src->w) / dst->w;
2927 render_y = ((render_y - dst->y) * src->h) / dst->h;
2928 }
2929
2930 render_x = (render_x / view->scale.x) - view->viewport.x;
2931 render_y = (render_y / view->scale.y) - view->viewport.y;
2932
2933 if (x) {
2934 *x = render_x;
2935 }
2936 if (y) {
2937 *y = render_y;
2938 }
2939 return true;
2940}
y
EGLSurface EGLint EGLint y
Definition eglext.h:1201
x
EGLSurface EGLint x
Definition eglext.h:1201
SDL_FRect
Definition SDL_rect.h:107
SDL_FRect::x
float x
Definition SDL_rect.h:108
SDL_FRect::w
float w
Definition SDL_rect.h:110
SDL_RenderViewState::logical_src_rect
SDL_FRect logical_src_rect
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:65

◆ SDL_RenderCoordinatesToWindow()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderCoordinatesToWindow ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
float x,
float y,
float * window_x,
float * window_y )
extern

Get a point in window coordinates when given a point in render coordinates.

This takes into account several states:

  • The window dimensions.
  • The logical presentation settings (SDL_SetRenderLogicalPresentation)
  • The scale (SDL_SetRenderScale)
  • The viewport (SDL_SetRenderViewport)
Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
xthe x coordinate in render coordinates.
ythe y coordinate in render coordinates.
window_xa pointer filled with the x coordinate in window coordinates.
window_ya pointer filled with the y coordinate in window coordinates.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_SetRenderLogicalPresentation
SDL_SetRenderScale
SDL_SetRenderViewport
2943{
2944 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
2945
2946 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = &renderer->main_view;
2947 x = (view->viewport.x + x) * view->scale.x;
2948 y = (view->viewport.y + y) * view->scale.y;
2949
2950 // Convert from render coordinates to pixels within the window
2951 if (view->logical_presentation_mode != SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_DISABLED) {
2952 const SDL_FRect *src = &view->logical_src_rect;
2953 const SDL_FRect *dst = &view->logical_dst_rect;
2954 x = dst->x + ((x * dst->w) / src->w);
2955 y = dst->y + ((y * dst->h) / src->h);
2956 }
2957
2958 // Convert from pixels within the window to window coordinates
2959 x /= renderer->dpi_scale.x;
2960 y /= renderer->dpi_scale.y;
2961
2962 if (window_x) {
2963 *window_x = x;
2964 }
2965 if (window_y) {
2966 *window_y = y;
2967 }
2968 return true;
2969}
SDL_FRect::h
float h
Definition SDL_rect.h:111
SDL_FRect::y
float y
Definition SDL_rect.h:109

References CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC, SDL_Renderer::dpi_scale, SDL_FRect::h, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_dst_rect, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_presentation_mode, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_src_rect, SDL_Renderer::main_view, SDL_RenderViewState::scale, SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_DISABLED, SDL_RenderViewState::viewport, SDL_FRect::w, SDL_FPoint::x, SDL_FRect::x, SDL_Rect::x, SDL_FPoint::y, SDL_FRect::y, and SDL_Rect::y.

◆ SDL_RenderDebugText()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderDebugText ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
float x,
float y,
const char * str )
extern

Draw debug text to an SDL_Renderer.

This function will render a string of text to an SDL_Renderer. Note that this is a convenience function for debugging, with severe limitations, and not intended to be used for production apps and games.

Among these limitations:

  • It accepts UTF-8 strings, but will only renders ASCII characters.
  • It has a single, tiny size (8x8 pixels). One can use logical presentation or scaling to adjust it, but it will be blurry.
  • It uses a simple, hardcoded bitmap font. It does not allow different font selections and it does not support truetype, for proper scaling.
  • It does no word-wrapping and does not treat newline characters as a line break. If the text goes out of the window, it's gone.

For serious text rendering, there are several good options, such as SDL_ttf, stb_truetype, or other external libraries.

On first use, this will create an internal texture for rendering glyphs. This texture will live until the renderer is destroyed.

The text is drawn in the color specified by SDL_SetRenderDrawColor().

Parameters
rendererthe renderer which should draw a line of text.
xthe x coordinate where the top-left corner of the text will draw.
ythe y coordinate where the top-left corner of the text will draw.
strthe string to render.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderDebugTextFormat
SDL_DEBUG_TEXT_FONT_CHARACTER_SIZE
5878{
5879 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
5880
5881 // Allocate a texture atlas for this renderer if needed.
5882 if (!renderer->debug_char_texture_atlas) {
5883 if (!CreateDebugTextAtlas(renderer)) {
5884 return false;
5885 }
5886 }
5887
5888 bool result = true;
5889
5890 Uint8 r, g, b, a;
5891 result &= SDL_GetRenderDrawColor(renderer, &r, &g, &b, &a);
5892 result &= SDL_SetTextureColorMod(renderer->debug_char_texture_atlas, r, g, b);
5893 result &= SDL_SetTextureAlphaMod(renderer->debug_char_texture_atlas, a);
5894
5895 float curx = x;
5896 Uint32 ch;
5897
5898 while (result && ((ch = SDL_StepUTF8(&s, NULL)) != 0)) {
5899 result &= DrawDebugCharacter(renderer, curx, y, ch);
5900 curx += SDL_DEBUG_TEXT_FONT_CHARACTER_SIZE;
5901 }
5902
5903 return result;
5904}

◆ SDL_RenderDebugTextFormat()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderDebugTextFormat ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
float x,
float y,
SDL_PRINTF_FORMAT_STRING const char * fmt,
... )
extern

Draw debug text to an SDL_Renderer.

This function will render a printf()-style format string to a renderer. Note that this is a convinence function for debugging, with severe limitations, and is not intended to be used for production apps and games.

For the full list of limitations and other useful information, see SDL_RenderDebugText.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer which should draw the text.
xthe x coordinate where the top-left corner of the text will draw.
ythe y coordinate where the top-left corner of the text will draw.
fmtthe format string to draw.
...additional parameters matching % tokens in the fmt string, if any.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderDebugText
SDL_DEBUG_TEXT_FONT_CHARACTER_SIZE
5907{
5908 va_list ap;
5909 va_start(ap, fmt);
5910
5911 // fast path to avoid unnecessary allocation and copy. If you're going through the dynapi, there's a good chance
5912 // you _always_ hit this path, since it probably had to process varargs before calling into the jumptable.
5913 if (SDL_strcmp(fmt, "%s") == 0) {
5914 const char *str = va_arg(ap, const char *);
5915 va_end(ap);
5916 return SDL_RenderDebugText(renderer, x, y, str);
5917 }
5918
5919 char *str = NULL;
5920 const int rc = SDL_vasprintf(&str, fmt, ap);
5921 va_end(ap);
5922
5923 if (rc == -1) {
5924 return false;
5925 }
5926
5927 const bool retval = SDL_RenderDebugText(renderer, x, y, str);
5928 SDL_free(str);
5929 return retval;
5930}

SDL_RenderFillRect
3871{
3872 SDL_FRect *frects;
3873 int i;
3874 bool result;
3875 bool isstack;
3876
3877 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
3878
3879 if (!rects) {
3880 return SDL_InvalidParamError("SDL_RenderFillRects(): rects");
3881 }
3882 if (count < 1) {
3883 return true;
3884 }
3885
3886#if DONT_DRAW_WHILE_HIDDEN
3887 // Don't draw while we're hidden
3888 if (renderer->hidden) {
3889 return true;
3890 }
3891#endif
3892
3893 frects = SDL_small_alloc(SDL_FRect, count, &isstack);
3894 if (!frects) {
3895 return false;
3896 }
3897
3898 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
3899 const float scale_x = view->current_scale.x;
3900 const float scale_y = view->current_scale.y;
3901 for (i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
3902 frects[i].x = rects[i].x * scale_x;
3903 frects[i].y = rects[i].y * scale_y;
3904 frects[i].w = rects[i].w * scale_x;
3905 frects[i].h = rects[i].h * scale_y;
3906 }
3907
3908 result = QueueCmdFillRects(renderer, frects, count);
3909
3910 SDL_small_free(frects, isstack);
3911
3912 return result;
3913}

◆ SDL_RenderGeometry()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderGeometry ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_Vertex * vertices,
int num_vertices,
const int * indices,
int num_indices )
extern

Render a list of triangles, optionally using a texture and indices into the vertex array Color and alpha modulation is done per vertex (SDL_SetTextureColorMod and SDL_SetTextureAlphaMod are ignored).

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
texture(optional) The SDL texture to use.
verticesvertices.
num_verticesnumber of vertices.
indices(optional) An array of integer indices into the 'vertices' array, if NULL all vertices will be rendered in sequential order.
num_indicesnumber of indices.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also

4727 if (vertices) {
4728 const float *xy = &vertices->position.x;
4729 int xy_stride = sizeof(SDL_Vertex);
4730 const SDL_FColor *color = &vertices->color;
4731 int color_stride = sizeof(SDL_Vertex);
4732 const float *uv = &vertices->tex_coord.x;
4733 int uv_stride = sizeof(SDL_Vertex);
4734 int size_indices = 4;
4735 return SDL_RenderGeometryRaw(renderer, texture, xy, xy_stride, color, color_stride, uv, uv_stride, num_vertices, indices, num_indices, size_indices);
4736 } else {
4737 return SDL_InvalidParamError("vertices");
4738 }
4739}

◆ SDL_RenderGeometryRaw()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderGeometryRaw ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const float * xy,
int xy_stride,
const SDL_FColor * color,
int color_stride,
const float * uv,
int uv_stride,
int num_vertices,
const void * indices,
int num_indices,
int size_indices )
extern

Render a list of triangles, optionally using a texture and indices into the vertex arrays Color and alpha modulation is done per vertex (SDL_SetTextureColorMod and SDL_SetTextureAlphaMod are ignored).

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
texture(optional) The SDL texture to use.
xyvertex positions.
xy_stridebyte size to move from one element to the next element.
colorvertex colors (as SDL_FColor).
color_stridebyte size to move from one element to the next element.
uvvertex normalized texture coordinates.
uv_stridebyte size to move from one element to the next element.
num_verticesnumber of vertices.
indices(optional) An array of indices into the 'vertices' arrays, if NULL all vertices will be rendered in sequential order.
num_indicesnumber of indices.
size_indicesindex size: 1 (byte), 2 (short), 4 (int).
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderGeometry
SDL_SetRenderTextureAddressMode
5136{
5137 int i;
5138 int count = indices ? num_indices : num_vertices;
5139 SDL_TextureAddressMode texture_address_mode_u;
5140 SDL_TextureAddressMode texture_address_mode_v;
5141
5142 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
5143
5144 if (!renderer->QueueGeometry) {
5145 return SDL_Unsupported();
5146 }
5147
5148 if (texture) {
5149 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
5150
5151 if (renderer != texture->renderer) {
5152 return SDL_SetError("Texture was not created with this renderer");
5153 }
5154 }
5155
5156 if (!xy) {
5157 return SDL_InvalidParamError("xy");
5158 }
5159
5160 if (!color) {
5161 return SDL_InvalidParamError("color");
5162 }
5163
5164 if (texture && !uv) {
5165 return SDL_InvalidParamError("uv");
5166 }
5167
5168 if (count % 3 != 0) {
5169 return SDL_InvalidParamError(indices ? "num_indices" : "num_vertices");
5170 }
5171
5172 if (indices) {
5173 if (size_indices != 1 && size_indices != 2 && size_indices != 4) {
5174 return SDL_InvalidParamError("size_indices");
5175 }
5176 } else {
5177 size_indices = 0;
5178 }
5179
5180#if DONT_DRAW_WHILE_HIDDEN
5181 // Don't draw while we're hidden
5182 if (renderer->hidden) {
5183 return true;
5184 }
5185#endif
5186
5187 if (num_vertices < 3) {
5188 return true;
5189 }
5190
5191 if (texture && texture->native) {
5192 texture = texture->native;
5193 }
5194
5195 texture_address_mode_u = renderer->texture_address_mode_u;
5196 texture_address_mode_v = renderer->texture_address_mode_v;
5197 if (texture &&
5198 (texture_address_mode_u == SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_AUTO ||
5199 texture_address_mode_v == SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_AUTO)) {
5200 for (i = 0; i < num_vertices; ++i) {
5201 const float *uv_ = (const float *)((const char *)uv + i * uv_stride);
5202 float u = uv_[0];
5203 float v = uv_[1];
5204 if (u < 0.0f || u > 1.0f) {
5205 if (texture_address_mode_u == SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_AUTO) {
5206 texture_address_mode_u = SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_WRAP;
5207 if (texture_address_mode_v != SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_AUTO) {
5208 break;
5209 }
5210 }
5211 }
5212 if (v < 0.0f || v > 1.0f) {
5213 if (texture_address_mode_v == SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_AUTO) {
5214 texture_address_mode_v = SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_WRAP;
5215 if (texture_address_mode_u != SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_AUTO) {
5216 break;
5217 }
5218 }
5219 }
5220 }
5221 if (texture_address_mode_u == SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_AUTO) {
5222 texture_address_mode_u = SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP;
5223 }
5224 if (texture_address_mode_v == SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_AUTO) {
5225 texture_address_mode_v = SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP;
5226 }
5227 }
5228
5229 if (indices) {
5230 for (i = 0; i < num_indices; ++i) {
5231 int j;
5232 if (size_indices == 4) {
5233 j = ((const Uint32 *)indices)[i];
5234 } else if (size_indices == 2) {
5235 j = ((const Uint16 *)indices)[i];
5236 } else {
5237 j = ((const Uint8 *)indices)[i];
5238 }
5239 if (j < 0 || j >= num_vertices) {
5240 return SDL_SetError("Values of 'indices' out of bounds");
5241 }
5242 }
5243 }
5244
5245 if (texture) {
5246 texture->last_command_generation = renderer->render_command_generation;
5247 }
5248
5249 // For the software renderer, try to reinterpret triangles as SDL_Rect
5250#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_RENDER_SW
5251 if (renderer->software &&
5252 texture_address_mode_u == SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP &&
5253 texture_address_mode_v == SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP) {
5254 return SDL_SW_RenderGeometryRaw(renderer, texture,
5255 xy, xy_stride, color, color_stride, uv, uv_stride, num_vertices,
5256 indices, num_indices, size_indices);
5257 }
5258#endif
5259
5260 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
5261 return QueueCmdGeometry(renderer, texture,
5262 xy, xy_stride, color, color_stride, uv, uv_stride,
5263 num_vertices, indices, num_indices, size_indices,
5264 view->current_scale.x, view->current_scale.y,
5265 texture_address_mode_u, texture_address_mode_v);
5266}

Uint16
uint16_t Uint16

◆ SDL_RenderLines()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderLines ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
const SDL_FPoint * points,
int count )
extern

Draw a series of connected lines on the current rendering target at subpixel precision.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer which should draw multiple lines.
pointsthe points along the lines.
countthe number of points, drawing count-1 lines.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderLine
3650{
3651 bool result = true;
3652
3653 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
3654
3655 if (!points) {
3656 return SDL_InvalidParamError("SDL_RenderLines(): points");
3657 }
3658 if (count < 2) {
3659 return true;
3660 }
3661
3662#if DONT_DRAW_WHILE_HIDDEN
3663 // Don't draw while we're hidden
3664 if (renderer->hidden) {
3665 return true;
3666 }
3667#endif
3668
3669 SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
3670 const bool islogical = (view->logical_presentation_mode != SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_DISABLED);
3671
3672 if (islogical || (renderer->line_method == SDL_RENDERLINEMETHOD_GEOMETRY)) {
3673 const float scale_x = view->current_scale.x;
3674 const float scale_y = view->current_scale.y;
3675 bool isstack1;
3676 bool isstack2;
3677 float *xy = SDL_small_alloc(float, 4 * 2 * count, &isstack1);
3678 int *indices = SDL_small_alloc(int, (4) * 3 * (count - 1) + (2) * 3 * (count), &isstack2);
3679
3680 if (xy && indices) {
3681 int i;
3682 float *ptr_xy = xy;
3683 int *ptr_indices = indices;
3684 const int xy_stride = 2 * sizeof(float);
3685 int num_vertices = 4 * count;
3686 int num_indices = 0;
3687 const int size_indices = 4;
3688 int cur_index = -4;
3689 const bool is_looping = (points[0].x == points[count - 1].x && points[0].y == points[count - 1].y);
3690 SDL_FPoint p; // previous point
3691 p.x = p.y = 0.0f;
3692 /* p q
3693
3694 0----1------ 4----5
3695 | \ |``\ | \ |
3696 | \ | ` `\| \ |
3697 3----2-------7----6
3698 */
3699 for (i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
3700 SDL_FPoint q = points[i]; // current point
3701
3702 q.x *= scale_x;
3703 q.y *= scale_y;
3704
3705 *ptr_xy++ = q.x;
3706 *ptr_xy++ = q.y;
3707 *ptr_xy++ = q.x + scale_x;
3708 *ptr_xy++ = q.y;
3709 *ptr_xy++ = q.x + scale_x;
3710 *ptr_xy++ = q.y + scale_y;
3711 *ptr_xy++ = q.x;
3712 *ptr_xy++ = q.y + scale_y;
3713
3714#define ADD_TRIANGLE(i1, i2, i3) \
3715 *ptr_indices++ = cur_index + (i1); \
3716 *ptr_indices++ = cur_index + (i2); \
3717 *ptr_indices++ = cur_index + (i3); \
3718 num_indices += 3;
3719
3720 // closed polyline, don´t draw twice the point
3721 if (i || !is_looping) {
3722 ADD_TRIANGLE(4, 5, 6)
3723 ADD_TRIANGLE(4, 6, 7)
3724 }
3725
3726 // first point only, no segment
3727 if (i == 0) {
3728 p = q;
3729 cur_index += 4;
3730 continue;
3731 }
3732
3733 // draw segment
3734 if (p.y == q.y) {
3735 if (p.x < q.x) {
3736 ADD_TRIANGLE(1, 4, 7)
3737 ADD_TRIANGLE(1, 7, 2)
3738 } else {
3739 ADD_TRIANGLE(5, 0, 3)
3740 ADD_TRIANGLE(5, 3, 6)
3741 }
3742 } else if (p.x == q.x) {
3743 if (p.y < q.y) {
3744 ADD_TRIANGLE(2, 5, 4)
3745 ADD_TRIANGLE(2, 4, 3)
3746 } else {
3747 ADD_TRIANGLE(6, 1, 0)
3748 ADD_TRIANGLE(6, 0, 7)
3749 }
3750 } else {
3751 if (p.y < q.y) {
3752 if (p.x < q.x) {
3753 ADD_TRIANGLE(1, 5, 4)
3754 ADD_TRIANGLE(1, 4, 2)
3755 ADD_TRIANGLE(2, 4, 7)
3756 ADD_TRIANGLE(2, 7, 3)
3757 } else {
3758 ADD_TRIANGLE(4, 0, 5)
3759 ADD_TRIANGLE(5, 0, 3)
3760 ADD_TRIANGLE(5, 3, 6)
3761 ADD_TRIANGLE(6, 3, 2)
3762 }
3763 } else {
3764 if (p.x < q.x) {
3765 ADD_TRIANGLE(0, 4, 7)
3766 ADD_TRIANGLE(0, 7, 1)
3767 ADD_TRIANGLE(1, 7, 6)
3768 ADD_TRIANGLE(1, 6, 2)
3769 } else {
3770 ADD_TRIANGLE(6, 5, 1)
3771 ADD_TRIANGLE(6, 1, 0)
3772 ADD_TRIANGLE(7, 6, 0)
3773 ADD_TRIANGLE(7, 0, 3)
3774 }
3775 }
3776 }
3777
3778 p = q;
3779 cur_index += 4;
3780 }
3781
3782 result = QueueCmdGeometry(renderer, NULL,
3783 xy, xy_stride, &renderer->color, 0 /* color_stride */, NULL, 0,
3784 num_vertices, indices, num_indices, size_indices,
3785 1.0f, 1.0f, SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP, SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP);
3786 }
3787
3788 SDL_small_free(xy, isstack1);
3789 SDL_small_free(indices, isstack2);
3790
3791 } else if (renderer->line_method == SDL_RENDERLINEMETHOD_POINTS) {
3792 result = RenderLinesWithRectsF(renderer, points, count);
3793 } else if (view->scale.x != 1.0f || view->scale.y != 1.0f) { /* we checked for logical scale elsewhere. */
3794 result = RenderLinesWithRectsF(renderer, points, count);
3795 } else {
3796 result = QueueCmdDrawLines(renderer, points, count);
3797 }
3798
3799 return result;
3800}
QueueCmdDrawLines
static bool QueueCmdDrawLines(SDL_Renderer *renderer, const SDL_FPoint *points, const int count)
Definition SDL_render.c:614
ADD_TRIANGLE
#define ADD_TRIANGLE(i1, i2, i3)
RenderLinesWithRectsF
static bool RenderLinesWithRectsF(SDL_Renderer *renderer, const SDL_FPoint *points, const int count)
Definition SDL_render.c:3578
SDL_RENDERLINEMETHOD_POINTS
@ SDL_RENDERLINEMETHOD_POINTS
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:204
SDL_RENDERLINEMETHOD_GEOMETRY
@ SDL_RENDERLINEMETHOD_GEOMETRY
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:206

References ADD_TRIANGLE, CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC, SDL_Renderer::color, count, SDL_RenderViewState::current_scale, SDL_Renderer::hidden, SDL_Renderer::line_method, SDL_RenderViewState::logical_presentation_mode, NULL, QueueCmdDrawLines(), QueueCmdGeometry(), RenderLinesWithRectsF(), SDL_RenderViewState::scale, SDL_InvalidParamError, SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_DISABLED, SDL_RENDERLINEMETHOD_GEOMETRY, SDL_RENDERLINEMETHOD_POINTS, SDL_small_alloc, SDL_small_free, SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP, SDL_Renderer::view, SDL_FPoint::x, and SDL_FPoint::y.

◆ SDL_RenderPresent()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderPresent ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
extern

Update the screen with any rendering performed since the previous call.

SDL's rendering functions operate on a backbuffer; that is, calling a rendering function such as SDL_RenderLine() does not directly put a line on the screen, but rather updates the backbuffer. As such, you compose your entire scene and present the composed backbuffer to the screen as a complete picture.

Therefore, when using SDL's rendering API, one does all drawing intended for the frame, and then calls this function once per frame to present the final drawing to the user.

The backbuffer should be considered invalidated after each present; do not assume that previous contents will exist between frames. You are strongly encouraged to call SDL_RenderClear() to initialize the backbuffer before starting each new frame's drawing, even if you plan to overwrite every pixel.

Please note, that in case of rendering to a texture - there is no need to call SDL_RenderPresent after drawing needed objects to a texture, and should not be done; you are only required to change back the rendering target to default via SDL_SetRenderTarget(renderer, NULL) afterwards, as textures by themselves do not have a concept of backbuffers. Calling SDL_RenderPresent while rendering to a texture will fail.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_CreateRenderer
SDL_RenderClear
SDL_RenderFillRect
SDL_RenderFillRects
SDL_RenderLine
SDL_RenderLines
SDL_RenderPoint
SDL_RenderPoints
SDL_RenderRect
SDL_RenderRects
SDL_SetRenderDrawBlendMode
SDL_SetRenderDrawColor
5399{
5400 bool presented = true;
5401
5402 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
5403
5404 if (renderer->target) {
5405 return SDL_SetError("You can't present on a render target");
5406 }
5407
5408 SDL_RenderLogicalPresentation(renderer);
5409
5410 if (renderer->transparent_window) {
5411 SDL_RenderApplyWindowShape(renderer);
5412 }
5413
5414 FlushRenderCommands(renderer); // time to send everything to the GPU!
5415
5416#if DONT_DRAW_WHILE_HIDDEN
5417 // Don't present while we're hidden
5418 if (renderer->hidden) {
5419 presented = false;
5420 } else
5421#endif
5422 if (!renderer->RenderPresent(renderer)) {
5423 presented = false;
5424 }
5425
5426 if (renderer->simulate_vsync ||
5427 (!presented && renderer->wanted_vsync)) {
5428 SDL_SimulateRenderVSync(renderer);
5429 }
5430 return true;
5431}

◆ SDL_RenderReadPixels()

SDL_DECLSPEC SDL_Surface *SDLCALL SDL_RenderReadPixels ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
const SDL_Rect * rect )
extern

Read pixels from the current rendering target.

The returned surface contains pixels inside the desired area clipped to the current viewport, and should be freed with SDL_DestroySurface().

Note that this returns the actual pixels on the screen, so if you are using logical presentation you should use SDL_GetRenderLogicalPresentationRect() to get the area containing your content.

WARNING: This is a very slow operation, and should not be used frequently. If you're using this on the main rendering target, it should be called after rendering and before SDL_RenderPresent().

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
rectan SDL_Rect structure representing the area to read, which will be clipped to the current viewport, or NULL for the entire viewport.
Returns
a new SDL_Surface on success or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
5298{
5299 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, NULL);
5300
5301 if (!renderer->RenderReadPixels) {
5302 SDL_Unsupported();
5303 return NULL;
5304 }
5305
5306 FlushRenderCommands(renderer); // we need to render before we read the results.
5307
5308 SDL_Rect real_rect = renderer->view->pixel_viewport;
5309
5310 if (rect) {
5311 if (!SDL_GetRectIntersection(rect, &real_rect, &real_rect)) {
5312 SDL_SetError("Can't read outside the current viewport");
5313 return NULL;
5314 }
5315 }
5316
5317 SDL_Surface *surface = renderer->RenderReadPixels(renderer, &real_rect);
5318 if (surface) {
5319 SDL_PropertiesID props = SDL_GetSurfaceProperties(surface);
5320
5321 if (renderer->target) {
5322 SDL_Texture *target = renderer->target;
5323 SDL_Texture *parent = SDL_GetPointerProperty(SDL_GetTextureProperties(target), SDL_PROP_TEXTURE_PARENT_POINTER, NULL);
5324 SDL_PixelFormat expected_format = (parent ? parent->format : target->format);
5325
5326 SDL_SetFloatProperty(props, SDL_PROP_SURFACE_SDR_WHITE_POINT_FLOAT, target->SDR_white_point);
5327 SDL_SetFloatProperty(props, SDL_PROP_SURFACE_HDR_HEADROOM_FLOAT, target->HDR_headroom);
5328
5329 // Set the expected surface format
5330 if ((surface->format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ARGB8888 && expected_format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_XRGB8888) ||
5331 (surface->format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_RGBA8888 && expected_format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_RGBX8888) ||
5332 (surface->format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_ABGR8888 && expected_format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_XBGR8888) ||
5333 (surface->format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_BGRA8888 && expected_format == SDL_PIXELFORMAT_BGRX8888)) {
5334 surface->format = expected_format;
5335 surface->fmt = SDL_GetPixelFormatDetails(expected_format);
5336 }
5337 } else {
5338 SDL_SetFloatProperty(props, SDL_PROP_SURFACE_SDR_WHITE_POINT_FLOAT, renderer->SDR_white_point);
5339 SDL_SetFloatProperty(props, SDL_PROP_SURFACE_HDR_HEADROOM_FLOAT, renderer->HDR_headroom);
5340 }
5341 }
5342 return surface;
5343}

3803{
3804 SDL_FRect frect;
3805 SDL_FPoint points[5];
3806
3807 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
3808
3809 // If 'rect' == NULL, then outline the whole surface
3810 if (!rect) {
3811 GetRenderViewportSize(renderer, &frect);
3812 rect = &frect;
3813 }
3814
3815 points[0].x = rect->x;
3816 points[0].y = rect->y;
3817 points[1].x = rect->x + rect->w - 1;
3818 points[1].y = rect->y;
3819 points[2].x = rect->x + rect->w - 1;
3820 points[2].y = rect->y + rect->h - 1;

3822 points[3].y = rect->y + rect->h - 1;
3823 points[4].x = rect->x;
3824 points[4].y = rect->y;

◆ SDL_RenderTexture()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderTexture ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_FRect * srcrect,
const SDL_FRect * dstrect )
extern

Copy a portion of the texture to the current rendering target at subpixel precision.

texturethe source texture.
srcrecta pointer to the source rectangle, or NULL for the entire texture.

Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderTextureRotated
SDL_RenderTextureTiled
3975{
3976 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
3977 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
3978
3979 if (renderer != texture->renderer) {
3980 return SDL_SetError("Texture was not created with this renderer");
3981 }
3982
3983#if DONT_DRAW_WHILE_HIDDEN
3984 // Don't draw while we're hidden
3985 if (renderer->hidden) {
3986 return true;
3987 }
3988#endif
3989
3990 SDL_FRect real_srcrect;
3991 real_srcrect.x = 0.0f;
3992 real_srcrect.y = 0.0f;
3993 real_srcrect.w = (float)texture->w;
3994 real_srcrect.h = (float)texture->h;
3995 if (srcrect) {
3996 if (!SDL_GetRectIntersectionFloat(srcrect, &real_srcrect, &real_srcrect)) {
3997 return true;
3998 }
3999 }
4000
4001 SDL_FRect full_dstrect;
4002 if (!dstrect) {
4003 GetRenderViewportSize(renderer, &full_dstrect);
4004 dstrect = &full_dstrect;
4005 }
4006
4007 if (texture->native) {
4008 texture = texture->native;
4009 }
4010
4011 texture->last_command_generation = renderer->render_command_generation;
4012
4013 return SDL_RenderTextureInternal(renderer, texture, &real_srcrect, dstrect);
4014}

References CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC, CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC, GetRenderViewportSize(), SDL_FRect::h, SDL_Texture::h, SDL_Renderer::hidden, SDL_Texture::last_command_generation, SDL_Texture::native, SDL_Renderer::render_command_generation, SDL_Texture::renderer, SDL_GetRectIntersectionFloat(), SDL_RenderTextureInternal(), SDL_SetError(), SDL_FRect::w, SDL_Texture::w, SDL_FRect::x, and SDL_FRect::y.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_RenderTexture9Grid()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderTexture9Grid ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_FRect * srcrect,
float left_width,
float right_width,
float top_height,
float bottom_height,
float scale,
const SDL_FRect * dstrect )
extern

Perform a scaled copy using the 9-grid algorithm to the current rendering target at subpixel precision.

The pixels in the texture are split into a 3x3 grid, using the different corner sizes for each corner, and the sides and center making up the remaining pixels. The corners are then scaled using scale and fit into the corners of the destination rectangle. The sides and center are then stretched into place to cover the remaining destination rectangle.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer which should copy parts of a texture.
texturethe source texture.
srcrectthe SDL_Rect structure representing the rectangle to be used for the 9-grid, or NULL to use the entire texture.
left_widththe width, in pixels, of the left corners in srcrect.
right_widththe width, in pixels, of the right corners in srcrect.
top_heightthe height, in pixels, of the top corners in srcrect.
bottom_heightthe height, in pixels, of the bottom corners in srcrect.
scalethe scale used to transform the corner of srcrect into the corner of dstrect, or 0.0f for an unscaled copy.
dstrecta pointer to the destination rectangle, or NULL for the entire rendering target.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderTexture
4449{
4450 SDL_FRect full_src, full_dst;
4451 SDL_FRect curr_src, curr_dst;
4452 float dst_left_width;
4453 float dst_right_width;
4454 float dst_top_height;
4455 float dst_bottom_height;
4456
4457 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
4458 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
4459
4460 if (renderer != texture->renderer) {
4461 return SDL_SetError("Texture was not created with this renderer");
4462 }
4463
4464 if (!srcrect) {
4465 full_src.x = 0;
4466 full_src.y = 0;
4467 full_src.w = (float)texture->w;
4468 full_src.h = (float)texture->h;
4469 srcrect = &full_src;
4470 }
4471
4472 if (!dstrect) {
4473 GetRenderViewportSize(renderer, &full_dst);
4474 dstrect = &full_dst;
4475 }
4476
4477 if (scale <= 0.0f || scale == 1.0f) {
4478 dst_left_width = SDL_ceilf(left_width);
4479 dst_right_width = SDL_ceilf(right_width);
4480 dst_top_height = SDL_ceilf(top_height);
4481 dst_bottom_height = SDL_ceilf(bottom_height);
4482 } else {
4483 dst_left_width = SDL_ceilf(left_width * scale);
4484 dst_right_width = SDL_ceilf(right_width * scale);
4485 dst_top_height = SDL_ceilf(top_height * scale);
4486 dst_bottom_height = SDL_ceilf(bottom_height * scale);
4487 }
4488
4489 // Center
4490 curr_src.x = srcrect->x + left_width;
4491 curr_src.y = srcrect->y + top_height;
4492 curr_src.w = srcrect->w - left_width - right_width;
4493 curr_src.h = srcrect->h - top_height - bottom_height;
4494 curr_dst.x = dstrect->x + dst_left_width;
4495 curr_dst.y = dstrect->y + dst_top_height;
4496 curr_dst.w = dstrect->w - dst_left_width - dst_right_width;
4497 curr_dst.h = dstrect->h - dst_top_height - dst_bottom_height;
4498 if (!SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4499 return false;
4500 }
4501
4502 // Upper-left corner
4503 curr_src.x = srcrect->x;
4504 curr_src.y = srcrect->y;
4505 curr_src.w = left_width;
4506 curr_src.h = top_height;
4507 curr_dst.x = dstrect->x;
4508 curr_dst.y = dstrect->y;
4509 curr_dst.w = dst_left_width;
4510 curr_dst.h = dst_top_height;
4511 if (!SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4512 return false;
4513 }
4514
4515 // Upper-right corner
4516 curr_src.x = srcrect->x + srcrect->w - right_width;
4517 curr_src.w = right_width;
4518 curr_dst.x = dstrect->x + dstrect->w - dst_right_width;
4519 curr_dst.w = dst_right_width;
4520 if (!SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4521 return false;
4522 }
4523
4524 // Lower-right corner
4525 curr_src.y = srcrect->y + srcrect->h - bottom_height;
4526 curr_src.h = bottom_height;
4527 curr_dst.y = dstrect->y + dstrect->h - dst_bottom_height;
4528 curr_dst.h = dst_bottom_height;
4529 if (!SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4530 return false;
4531 }
4532
4533 // Lower-left corner
4534 curr_src.x = srcrect->x;
4535 curr_src.w = left_width;
4536 curr_dst.x = dstrect->x;
4537 curr_dst.w = dst_left_width;
4538 if (!SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4539 return false;
4540 }

4545 curr_dst.y = dstrect->y + dst_top_height;
4546 curr_dst.h = dstrect->h - dst_top_height - dst_bottom_height;
4547 if (!SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4548 return false;

4554 curr_dst.x = dstrect->x + dstrect->w - dst_right_width;
4555 curr_dst.w = dst_right_width;
4556 if (!SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4557 return false;
4558 }
4559

4561 curr_src.x = srcrect->x + left_width;
4562 curr_src.y = srcrect->y;
4563 curr_src.w = srcrect->w - left_width - right_width;
4564 curr_src.h = top_height;
4565 curr_dst.x = dstrect->x + dst_left_width;
4566 curr_dst.y = dstrect->y;
4567 curr_dst.w = dstrect->w - dst_left_width - dst_right_width;
4568 curr_dst.h = dst_top_height;
4569 if (!SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4570 return false;
4571 }
4572
4573 // Bottom
4574 curr_src.y = srcrect->y + srcrect->h - bottom_height;
4575 curr_src.h = bottom_height;
4576 curr_dst.y = dstrect->y + dstrect->h - dst_bottom_height;
4577 curr_dst.h = dst_bottom_height;
4578 if (!SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, &curr_src, &curr_dst)) {
4579 return false;
4580 }
4581
4582 return true;
4583}

◆ SDL_RenderTexture9GridTiled()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderTexture9GridTiled ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_FRect * srcrect,
float left_width,
float right_width,
float top_height,
float bottom_height,
float scale,
const SDL_FRect * dstrect,
float tileScale )
extern

Perform a scaled copy using the 9-grid algorithm to the current rendering target at subpixel precision.

The pixels in the texture are split into a 3x3 grid, using the different corner sizes for each corner, and the sides and center making up the remaining pixels. The corners are then scaled using scale and fit into the corners of the destination rectangle. The sides and center are then tiled into place to cover the remaining destination rectangle.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer which should copy parts of a texture.
texturethe source texture.
srcrectthe SDL_Rect structure representing the rectangle to be used for the 9-grid, or NULL to use the entire texture.
left_widththe width, in pixels, of the left corners in srcrect.
right_widththe width, in pixels, of the right corners in srcrect.
top_heightthe height, in pixels, of the top corners in srcrect.
bottom_heightthe height, in pixels, of the bottom corners in srcrect.
scalethe scale used to transform the corner of srcrect into the corner of dstrect, or 0.0f for an unscaled copy.
dstrecta pointer to the destination rectangle, or NULL for the entire rendering target.
tileScalethe scale used to transform the borders and center of srcrect into the borders and middle of dstrect, or 1.0f for an unscaled copy.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.4.0.
See also
SDL_RenderTexture

◆ SDL_RenderTextureAffine()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderTextureAffine ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_FRect * srcrect,
const SDL_FPoint * origin,
const SDL_FPoint * right,
const SDL_FPoint * down )
extern

Copy a portion of the source texture to the current rendering target, with affine transform, at subpixel precision.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer which should copy parts of a texture.
texturethe source texture.
srcrecta pointer to the source rectangle, or NULL for the entire texture.
origina pointer to a point indicating where the top-left corner of srcrect should be mapped to, or NULL for the rendering target's origin.
righta pointer to a point indicating where the top-right corner of srcrect should be mapped to, or NULL for the rendering target's top-right corner.
downa pointer to a point indicating where the bottom-left corner of srcrect should be mapped to, or NULL for the rendering target's bottom-left corner.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
You may only call this function from the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderTexture
4018{
4019 SDL_FRect real_srcrect;
4020 SDL_FRect real_dstrect;
4021 bool result;
4022
4023 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
4024 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
4025
4026 if (renderer != texture->renderer) {
4027 return SDL_SetError("Texture was not created with this renderer");
4028 }
4029 if (!renderer->QueueCopyEx && !renderer->QueueGeometry) {
4030 return SDL_SetError("Renderer does not support RenderCopyEx");
4031 }
4032
4033#if DONT_DRAW_WHILE_HIDDEN
4034 // Don't draw while we're hidden
4035 if (renderer->hidden) {
4036 return true;
4037 }
4038#endif
4039
4040 real_srcrect.x = 0.0f;
4041 real_srcrect.y = 0.0f;
4042 real_srcrect.w = (float)texture->w;
4043 real_srcrect.h = (float)texture->h;
4044 if (srcrect) {
4045 if (!SDL_GetRectIntersectionFloat(srcrect, &real_srcrect, &real_srcrect)) {
4046 return true;
4047 }
4048 }
4049
4050 GetRenderViewportSize(renderer, &real_dstrect);
4051
4052 if (texture->native) {
4053 texture = texture->native;
4054 }
4055
4056 texture->last_command_generation = renderer->render_command_generation;
4057
4058 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
4059 const float scale_x = view->current_scale.x;
4060 const float scale_y = view->current_scale.y;
4061
4062 {
4063 float xy[8];
4064 const int xy_stride = 2 * sizeof(float);
4065 float uv[8];
4066 const int uv_stride = 2 * sizeof(float);
4067 const int num_vertices = 4;
4068 const int *indices = rect_index_order;
4069 const int num_indices = 6;
4070 const int size_indices = 4;
4071
4072 float minu = real_srcrect.x / texture->w;
4073 float minv = real_srcrect.y / texture->h;
4074 float maxu = (real_srcrect.x + real_srcrect.w) / texture->w;
4075 float maxv = (real_srcrect.y + real_srcrect.h) / texture->h;
4076
4077 uv[0] = minu;
4078 uv[1] = minv;
4079 uv[2] = maxu;
4080 uv[3] = minv;
4081 uv[4] = maxu;
4082 uv[5] = maxv;
4083 uv[6] = minu;
4084 uv[7] = maxv;
4085
4086 // (minx, miny)
4087 if (origin) {
4088 xy[0] = origin->x;
4089 xy[1] = origin->y;
4090 } else {
4091 xy[0] = real_dstrect.x;
4092 xy[1] = real_dstrect.y;
4093 }
4094
4095 // (maxx, miny)
4096 if (right) {
4097 xy[2] = right->x;
4098 xy[3] = right->y;
4099 } else {
4100 xy[2] = real_dstrect.x + real_dstrect.w;
4101 xy[3] = real_dstrect.y;
4102 }
4103
4104 // (minx, maxy)
4105 if (down) {
4106 xy[6] = down->x;
4107 xy[7] = down->y;
4108 } else {
4109 xy[6] = real_dstrect.x;
4110 xy[7] = real_dstrect.y + real_dstrect.h;
4111 }
4112
4113 // (maxx, maxy)
4114 if (origin || right || down) {
4115 xy[4] = xy[2] + xy[6] - xy[0];
4116 xy[5] = xy[3] + xy[7] - xy[1];
4117 } else {
4118 xy[4] = real_dstrect.x + real_dstrect.w;
4119 xy[5] = real_dstrect.y + real_dstrect.h;
4120 }
4121
4122 result = QueueCmdGeometry(
4123 renderer, texture,
4124 xy, xy_stride,
4125 &texture->color, 0 /* color_stride */,
4126 uv, uv_stride,
4127 num_vertices, indices, num_indices, size_indices,
4128 scale_x, scale_y, SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP, SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP
4129 );
4130 }
4131 return result;
4132}
right

Definition SDL_glfuncs.h:285

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ SDL_RenderTextureRotated()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderTextureRotated ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_FRect * srcrect,
const SDL_FRect * dstrect,
double angle,
const SDL_FPoint * center,
SDL_FlipMode flip )
extern

Copy a portion of the source texture to the current rendering target, with rotation and flipping, at subpixel precision.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer which should copy parts of a texture.
texturethe source texture.
srcrecta pointer to the source rectangle, or NULL for the entire texture.
dstrecta pointer to the destination rectangle, or NULL for the entire rendering target.
anglean angle in degrees that indicates the rotation that will be applied to dstrect, rotating it in a clockwise direction.
centera pointer to a point indicating the point around which dstrect will be rotated (if NULL, rotation will be done around dstrect.w/2, dstrect.h/2).
flipan SDL_FlipMode value stating which flipping actions should be performed on the texture.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderTexture
4137{
4138 SDL_FRect real_srcrect;
4139 SDL_FPoint real_center;
4140 bool result;
4141
4142 if (flip == SDL_FLIP_NONE && (int)(angle / 360) == angle / 360) { // fast path when we don't need rotation or flipping
4143 return SDL_RenderTexture(renderer, texture, srcrect, dstrect);
4144 }
4145
4146 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
4147 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
4148
4149 if (renderer != texture->renderer) {
4150 return SDL_SetError("Texture was not created with this renderer");
4151 }
4152 if (!renderer->QueueCopyEx && !renderer->QueueGeometry) {
4153 return SDL_SetError("Renderer does not support RenderCopyEx");
4154 }
4155
4156#if DONT_DRAW_WHILE_HIDDEN
4157 // Don't draw while we're hidden
4158 if (renderer->hidden) {
4159 return true;
4160 }
4161#endif
4162
4163 real_srcrect.x = 0.0f;
4164 real_srcrect.y = 0.0f;
4165 real_srcrect.w = (float)texture->w;
4166 real_srcrect.h = (float)texture->h;
4167 if (srcrect) {
4168 if (!SDL_GetRectIntersectionFloat(srcrect, &real_srcrect, &real_srcrect)) {
4169 return true;
4170 }
4171 }
4172
4173 // We don't intersect the dstrect with the viewport as RenderCopy does because of potential rotation clipping issues... TODO: should we?
4174 SDL_FRect full_dstrect;
4175 if (!dstrect) {
4176 GetRenderViewportSize(renderer, &full_dstrect);
4177 dstrect = &full_dstrect;
4178 }
4179
4180 if (texture->native) {
4181 texture = texture->native;
4182 }
4183
4184 if (center) {
4185 real_center = *center;
4186 } else {
4187 real_center.x = dstrect->w / 2.0f;
4188 real_center.y = dstrect->h / 2.0f;
4189 }
4190
4191 texture->last_command_generation = renderer->render_command_generation;
4192
4193 const SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
4194 const float scale_x = view->current_scale.x;
4195 const float scale_y = view->current_scale.y;
4196
4197 const bool use_rendergeometry = (!renderer->QueueCopyEx);
4198 if (use_rendergeometry) {
4199 float xy[8];
4200 const int xy_stride = 2 * sizeof(float);
4201 float uv[8];
4202 const int uv_stride = 2 * sizeof(float);
4203 const int num_vertices = 4;
4204 const int *indices = rect_index_order;
4205 const int num_indices = 6;
4206 const int size_indices = 4;
4207 float minu, minv, maxu, maxv;
4208 float minx, miny, maxx, maxy;
4209 float centerx, centery;
4210
4211 float s_minx, s_miny, s_maxx, s_maxy;
4212 float c_minx, c_miny, c_maxx, c_maxy;
4213
4214 const float radian_angle = (float)((SDL_PI_D * angle) / 180.0);
4215 const float s = SDL_sinf(radian_angle);
4216 const float c = SDL_cosf(radian_angle);
4217
4218 minu = real_srcrect.x / texture->w;
4219 minv = real_srcrect.y / texture->h;
4220 maxu = (real_srcrect.x + real_srcrect.w) / texture->w;
4221 maxv = (real_srcrect.y + real_srcrect.h) / texture->h;
4222
4223 centerx = real_center.x + dstrect->x;
4224 centery = real_center.y + dstrect->y;
4225
4226 if (flip & SDL_FLIP_HORIZONTAL) {
4227 minx = dstrect->x + dstrect->w;
4228 maxx = dstrect->x;
4229 } else {
4230 minx = dstrect->x;
4231 maxx = dstrect->x + dstrect->w;
4232 }
4233
4234 if (flip & SDL_FLIP_VERTICAL) {
4235 miny = dstrect->y + dstrect->h;
4236 maxy = dstrect->y;
4237 } else {
4238 miny = dstrect->y;
4239 maxy = dstrect->y + dstrect->h;
4240 }
4241
4242 uv[0] = minu;
4243 uv[1] = minv;
4244 uv[2] = maxu;
4245 uv[3] = minv;
4246 uv[4] = maxu;
4247 uv[5] = maxv;
4248 uv[6] = minu;
4249 uv[7] = maxv;
4250
4251 /* apply rotation with 2x2 matrix ( c -s )
4252 * ( s c ) */
4253 s_minx = s * (minx - centerx);
4254 s_miny = s * (miny - centery);
4255 s_maxx = s * (maxx - centerx);
4256 s_maxy = s * (maxy - centery);
4257 c_minx = c * (minx - centerx);
4258 c_miny = c * (miny - centery);
4259 c_maxx = c * (maxx - centerx);
4260 c_maxy = c * (maxy - centery);
4261
4262 // (minx, miny)
4263 xy[0] = (c_minx - s_miny) + centerx;
4264 xy[1] = (s_minx + c_miny) + centery;
4265 // (maxx, miny)
4266 xy[2] = (c_maxx - s_miny) + centerx;
4267 xy[3] = (s_maxx + c_miny) + centery;
4268 // (maxx, maxy)
4269 xy[4] = (c_maxx - s_maxy) + centerx;
4270 xy[5] = (s_maxx + c_maxy) + centery;
4271 // (minx, maxy)
4272 xy[6] = (c_minx - s_maxy) + centerx;
4273 xy[7] = (s_minx + c_maxy) + centery;
4274
4275 result = QueueCmdGeometry(renderer, texture,
4276 xy, xy_stride, &texture->color, 0 /* color_stride */, uv, uv_stride,
4277 num_vertices, indices, num_indices, size_indices,
4278 scale_x, scale_y, SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP, SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP);
4279 } else {
4280 result = QueueCmdCopyEx(renderer, texture, &real_srcrect, dstrect, angle, &real_center, flip, scale_x, scale_y);
4281 }
4282 return result;
4283}
QueueCmdCopyEx
static bool QueueCmdCopyEx(SDL_Renderer *renderer, SDL_Texture *texture, const SDL_FRect *srcquad, const SDL_FRect *dstrect, const double angle, const SDL_FPoint *center, const SDL_FlipMode flip, float scale_x, float scale_y)
Definition SDL_render.c:713
SDL_PI_D
#define SDL_PI_D
Definition SDL_stdinc.h:4451
SDL_sinf
SDL_DECLSPEC float SDLCALL SDL_sinf(float x)
Definition SDL_stdlib.c:463
SDL_cosf
SDL_DECLSPEC float SDLCALL SDL_cosf(float x)
Definition SDL_stdlib.c:172
SDL_FLIP_VERTICAL
@ SDL_FLIP_VERTICAL
Definition SDL_surface.h:101
SDL_FLIP_NONE
@ SDL_FLIP_NONE
Definition SDL_surface.h:99
SDL_FLIP_HORIZONTAL
@ SDL_FLIP_HORIZONTAL
Definition SDL_surface.h:100

References CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC, CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC, SDL_Texture::color, SDL_RenderViewState::current_scale, GetRenderViewportSize(), SDL_FRect::h, SDL_Texture::h, SDL_Renderer::hidden, SDL_Texture::last_command_generation, SDL_Texture::native, QueueCmdCopyEx(), QueueCmdGeometry(), SDL_Renderer::QueueCopyEx, SDL_Renderer::QueueGeometry, rect_index_order, SDL_Renderer::render_command_generation, SDL_Texture::renderer, SDL_cosf(), SDL_FLIP_HORIZONTAL, SDL_FLIP_NONE, SDL_FLIP_VERTICAL, SDL_GetRectIntersectionFloat(), SDL_PI_D, SDL_RenderTexture(), SDL_SetError(), SDL_sinf(), SDL_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP, SDL_Renderer::view, SDL_FRect::w, SDL_Texture::w, SDL_FPoint::x, SDL_FRect::x, SDL_FPoint::y, and SDL_FRect::y.

◆ SDL_RenderTextureTiled()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderTextureTiled ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_FRect * srcrect,
float scale,
const SDL_FRect * dstrect )
extern

Tile a portion of the texture to the current rendering target at subpixel precision.

The pixels in srcrect will be repeated as many times as needed to completely fill dstrect.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer which should copy parts of a texture.
texturethe source texture.
srcrecta pointer to the source rectangle, or NULL for the entire texture.
scalethe scale used to transform srcrect into the destination rectangle, e.g. a 32x32 texture with a scale of 2 would fill 64x64 tiles.
dstrecta pointer to the destination rectangle, or NULL for the entire rendering target.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_RenderTexture
4394{
4395 SDL_FRect real_srcrect;
4396
4397 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
4398 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
4399
4400 if (renderer != texture->renderer) {
4401 return SDL_SetError("Texture was not created with this renderer");
4402 }
4403
4404 if (scale <= 0.0f) {
4405 return SDL_InvalidParamError("scale");
4406 }
4407
4408#if DONT_DRAW_WHILE_HIDDEN
4409 // Don't draw while we're hidden
4410 if (renderer->hidden) {
4411 return true;
4412 }
4413#endif
4414
4415 real_srcrect.x = 0.0f;
4416 real_srcrect.y = 0.0f;
4417 real_srcrect.w = (float)texture->w;
4418 real_srcrect.h = (float)texture->h;
4419 if (srcrect) {
4420 if (!SDL_GetRectIntersectionFloat(srcrect, &real_srcrect, &real_srcrect)) {
4421 return true;
4422 }
4423 }
4424

4426 if (!dstrect) {
4427 GetRenderViewportSize(renderer, &full_dstrect);
4428 dstrect = &full_dstrect;
4429 }
4430
4431 if (texture->native) {
4432 texture = texture->native;
4433 }
4434
4435 texture->last_command_generation = renderer->render_command_generation;
4436
4437 // See if we can use geometry with repeating texture coordinates
4438 if (!renderer->software &&
4439 (!srcrect ||
4440 (real_srcrect.x == 0.0f && real_srcrect.y == 0.0f &&
4441 real_srcrect.w == (float)texture->w && real_srcrect.h == (float)texture->h))) {
4442 return SDL_RenderTextureTiled_Wrap(renderer, texture, &real_srcrect, scale, dstrect);
4443 } else {
4444 return SDL_RenderTextureTiled_Iterate(renderer, texture, &real_srcrect, scale, dstrect);
4445 }
4446}

◆ SDL_RenderViewportSet()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_RenderViewportSet ( SDL_Renderer * renderer)
extern

Return whether an explicit rectangle was set as the viewport.

This is useful if you're saving and restoring the viewport and want to know whether you should restore a specific rectangle or NULL.

Each render target has its own viewport. This function checks the viewport for the current render target.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
Returns
true if the viewport was set to a specific rectangle, or false if it was set to NULL (the entire target).
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.

◆ SDL_SetGPURenderStateFragmentUniforms()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetGPURenderStateFragmentUniforms ( SDL_GPURenderState * state,
Uint32 slot_index,
const void * data,
Uint32 length )
extern

Set fragment shader uniform variables in a custom GPU render state.

The data is copied and will be pushed using SDL_PushGPUFragmentUniformData() during draw call execution.

Parameters
statethe state to modify.
slot_indexthe fragment uniform slot to push data to.
dataclient data to write.
lengththe length of the data to write.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should be called on the thread that created the renderer.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.4.0.
6023{
6024 if (!state) {
6025 return SDL_InvalidParamError("state");
6026 }
6027
6028 if (!FlushRenderCommandsIfGPURenderStateNeeded(state)) {
6029 return false;
6030 }
6031
6032 for (int i = 0; i < state->num_uniform_buffers; i++) {
6033 SDL_GPURenderStateUniformBuffer *buffer = &state->uniform_buffers[i];
6034 if (buffer->slot_index == slot_index) {
6035 void *new_data = SDL_realloc(buffer->data, length);
6036 if (!new_data) {
6037 return false;
6038 }
6039 SDL_memcpy(new_data, data, length);
6040 buffer->data = new_data;
6041 buffer->length = length;
6042 return true;
6043 }
6044 }
6045
6046 SDL_GPURenderStateUniformBuffer *buffers = (SDL_GPURenderStateUniformBuffer *)SDL_realloc(state->uniform_buffers, (state->num_uniform_buffers + 1) * sizeof(*state->uniform_buffers));
6047 if (!buffers) {
6048 return false;
6049 }
6050
6051 SDL_GPURenderStateUniformBuffer *buffer = &buffers[state->num_uniform_buffers];
6052 buffer->slot_index = slot_index;
6053 buffer->length = length;
6054 buffer->data = SDL_malloc(length);
6055 if (!buffer->data) {
6056 SDL_free(buffers);
6057 return false;
6058 }
6059 SDL_memcpy(buffer->data, data, length);
6060
6061 state->uniform_buffers = buffers;
6062 ++state->num_uniform_buffers;
6063 return true;
6064}
SDL_realloc
void * SDL_realloc(void *ptr, size_t size)

◆ SDL_SetRenderColorScale()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetRenderColorScale ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
float scale )
extern

Set the color scale used for render operations.

The color scale is an additional scale multiplied into the pixel color value while rendering. This can be used to adjust the brightness of colors during HDR rendering, or changing HDR video brightness when playing on an SDR display.

The color scale does not affect the alpha channel, only the color brightness.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
scalethe color scale value.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetRenderColorScale

3344 return true;

◆ SDL_SetRenderLogicalPresentation()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetRenderLogicalPresentation ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
int w,
int h,
SDL_RendererLogicalPresentation mode )
extern

Set a device-independent resolution and presentation mode for rendering.

This function sets the width and height of the logical rendering output. The renderer will act as if the current render target is always the requested dimensions, scaling to the actual resolution as necessary.

This can be useful for games that expect a fixed size, but would like to scale the output to whatever is available, regardless of how a user resizes a window, or if the display is high DPI.

Logical presentation can be used with both render target textures and the renderer's window; the state is unique to each render target, and this function sets the state for the current render target. It might be useful to draw to a texture that matches the window dimensions with logical presentation enabled, and then draw that texture across the entire window with logical presentation disabled. Be careful not to render both with logical presentation enabled, however, as this could produce double-letterboxing, etc.

You can disable logical coordinates by setting the mode to SDL_LOGICAL_PRESENTATION_DISABLED, and in that case you get the full pixel resolution of the render target; it is safe to toggle logical presentation during the rendering of a frame: perhaps most of the rendering is done to specific dimensions but to make fonts look sharp, the app turns off logical presentation while drawing text, for example.

For the renderer's window, letterboxing is drawn into the framebuffer if logical presentation is enabled during SDL_RenderPresent; be sure to reenable it before presenting if you were toggling it, otherwise the letterbox areas might have artifacts from previous frames (or artifacts from external overlays, etc). Letterboxing is never drawn into texture render targets; be sure to call SDL_RenderClear() before drawing into the texture so the letterboxing areas are cleared, if appropriate.

You can convert coordinates in an event into rendering coordinates using SDL_ConvertEventToRenderCoordinates().

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
wthe width of the logical resolution.
hthe height of the logical resolution.
modethe presentation mode used.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_ConvertEventToRenderCoordinates
SDL_GetRenderLogicalPresentation
SDL_GetRenderLogicalPresentationRect
2753{
2754 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
2755
2756 SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
2757 view->logical_presentation_mode = mode;
2758 view->logical_w = w;
2759 view->logical_h = h;
2760
2761 UpdateLogicalPresentation(renderer);
2762
2763 return true;
2764}
UpdateLogicalPresentation

◆ SDL_SetRenderScale()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetRenderScale ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
float scaleX,
float scaleY )
extern

Set the drawing scale for rendering on the current target.

The drawing coordinates are scaled by the x/y scaling factors before they are used by the renderer. This allows resolution independent drawing with a single coordinate system.

If this results in scaling or subpixel drawing by the rendering backend, it will be handled using the appropriate quality hints. For best results use integer scaling factors.

Each render target has its own scale. This function sets the scale for the current render target.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
scaleXthe horizontal scaling factor.
scaleYthe vertical scaling factor.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetRenderScale
3200{
3201 bool result = true;
3202
3203 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
3204
3205 SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
3206
3207 if ((view->scale.x == scaleX) && (view->scale.y == scaleY)) {
3208 return true;
3209 }
3210
3211 view->scale.x = scaleX;
3212 view->scale.y = scaleY;
3213 view->current_scale.x = scaleX * view->logical_scale.x;
3214 view->current_scale.y = scaleY * view->logical_scale.y;
3215 UpdatePixelViewport(renderer, view);
3216 UpdatePixelClipRect(renderer, view);
3217
3218 // The scale affects the existing viewport and clip rectangle
3219 result &= QueueCmdSetViewport(renderer);
3220 result &= QueueCmdSetClipRect(renderer);
3221 return result;
3222}
QueueCmdSetViewport
static bool QueueCmdSetViewport(SDL_Renderer *renderer)
Definition SDL_render.c:445

◆ SDL_SetRenderTarget()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetRenderTarget ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
SDL_Texture * texture )
extern

Set a texture as the current rendering target.

The default render target is the window for which the renderer was created. To stop rendering to a texture and render to the window again, call this function with a NULL texture.

Viewport, cliprect, scale, and logical presentation are unique to each render target. Get and set functions for these states apply to the current render target set by this function, and those states persist on each target when the current render target changes.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
texturethe targeted texture, which must be created with the SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_TARGET flag, or NULL to render to the window instead of a texture.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetRenderTarget
2567{
2568 // texture == NULL is valid and means reset the target to the window
2569 if (texture) {
2570 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
2571 if (renderer != texture->renderer) {
2572 return SDL_SetError("Texture was not created with this renderer");
2573 }
2574 if (texture->access != SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_TARGET) {
2575 return SDL_SetError("Texture not created with SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_TARGET");
2576 }
2577 if (texture->native) {
2578 // Always render to the native texture
2579 texture = texture->native;
2580 }
2581 }
2582
2583 if (texture == renderer->target) {
2584 // Nothing to do!
2585 return true;
2586 }
2587
2588 FlushRenderCommands(renderer); // time to send everything to the GPU!
2589
2590 SDL_LockMutex(renderer->target_mutex);
2591
2592 renderer->target = texture;
2593 if (texture) {
2594 renderer->view = &texture->view;
2595 } else {
2596 renderer->view = &renderer->main_view;
2597 }
2598 UpdateColorScale(renderer);
2599
2600 if (!renderer->SetRenderTarget(renderer, texture)) {
2601 SDL_UnlockMutex(renderer->target_mutex);
2602 return false;
2603 }
2604
2605 SDL_UnlockMutex(renderer->target_mutex);
2606
2607 if (!QueueCmdSetViewport(renderer)) {
2608 return false;
2609 }
2610 if (!QueueCmdSetClipRect(renderer)) {
2611 return false;
2612 }
2613
2614 // All set!
2615 return true;
2616}
SDL_UnlockMutex
SDL_DECLSPEC void SDLCALL SDL_UnlockMutex(SDL_Mutex *mutex)
Definition SDL_sysmutex.c:108
SDL_LockMutex
SDL_DECLSPEC void SDLCALL SDL_LockMutex(SDL_Mutex *mutex)
Definition SDL_sysmutex.c:64
SDL_Renderer::SetRenderTarget
bool(* SetRenderTarget)(SDL_Renderer *renderer, SDL_Texture *texture)
Definition SDL_sysrender.h:253

◆ SDL_SetRenderViewport()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetRenderViewport ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
const SDL_Rect * rect )
extern

Set the drawing area for rendering on the current target.

Drawing will clip to this area (separately from any clipping done with SDL_SetRenderClipRect), and the top left of the area will become coordinate (0, 0) for future drawing commands.

The area's width and height must be >= 0.

Each render target has its own viewport. This function sets the viewport for the current render target.

Parameters
rendererthe rendering context.
rectthe SDL_Rect structure representing the drawing area, or NULL to set the viewport to the entire target.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetRenderViewport
SDL_RenderViewportSet
3041{
3042 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
3043
3044 SDL_RenderViewState *view = renderer->view;
3045 if (rect) {
3046 if ((rect->w < 0) || (rect->h < 0)) {
3047 return SDL_SetError("rect has a negative size");
3048 }
3049 SDL_copyp(&view->viewport, rect);
3050 } else {
3051 view->viewport.x = view->viewport.y = 0;
3052 view->viewport.w = view->viewport.h = -1;
3053 }
3054 UpdatePixelViewport(renderer, view);
3055
3056 return QueueCmdSetViewport(renderer);
3057}

References CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC, SDL_Rect::h, QueueCmdSetViewport(), SDL_copyp, SDL_SetError(), UpdatePixelViewport(), SDL_Renderer::view, SDL_RenderViewState::viewport, SDL_Rect::w, SDL_Rect::x, and SDL_Rect::y.

◆ SDL_SetRenderVSync()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetRenderVSync ( SDL_Renderer * renderer,
int vsync )
extern

Toggle VSync of the given renderer.

When a renderer is created, vsync defaults to SDL_RENDERER_VSYNC_DISABLED.

The vsync parameter can be 1 to synchronize present with every vertical refresh, 2 to synchronize present with every second vertical refresh, etc., SDL_RENDERER_VSYNC_ADAPTIVE for late swap tearing (adaptive vsync), or SDL_RENDERER_VSYNC_DISABLED to disable. Not every value is supported by every driver, so you should check the return value to see whether the requested setting is supported.

Parameters
rendererthe renderer to toggle.
vsyncthe vertical refresh sync interval.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetRenderVSync
5733{
5734 CHECK_RENDERER_MAGIC(renderer, false);
5735
5736 renderer->wanted_vsync = vsync ? true : false;
5737
5738 // for the software renderer, forward the call to the WindowTexture renderer
5739#ifdef SDL_VIDEO_RENDER_SW
5740 if (renderer->software) {
5741 if (!renderer->window) {
5742 if (!vsync) {
5743 return true;
5744 } else {
5745 return SDL_Unsupported();
5746 }
5747 }
5748 if (SDL_SetWindowTextureVSync(NULL, renderer->window, vsync)) {
5749 renderer->simulate_vsync = false;
5750 return true;
5751 }
5752 }
5753#endif
5754
5755 if (!renderer->SetVSync ||
5756 !renderer->SetVSync(renderer, vsync)) {
5757 switch (vsync) {
5758 case 0:
5759 renderer->simulate_vsync = false;
5760 break;
5761 case 1:
5762 renderer->simulate_vsync = true;
5763 break;
5764 default:
5765 return SDL_Unsupported();
5766 }
5767 }
5768 SDL_SetNumberProperty(SDL_GetRendererProperties(renderer), SDL_PROP_RENDERER_VSYNC_NUMBER, vsync);
5769 return true;
5770}
true
#define true
Definition SDL_stdinc.h:74

◆ SDL_SetTextureAlphaMod()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetTextureAlphaMod ( SDL_Texture * texture,
Uint8 alpha )
extern

Set an additional alpha value multiplied into render copy operations.

When this texture is rendered, during the copy operation the source alpha value is modulated by this alpha value according to the following formula:

srcA = srcA * (alpha / 255)

Alpha modulation is not always supported by the renderer; it will return false if alpha modulation is not supported.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
alphathe source alpha value multiplied into copy operations.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetTextureAlphaMod
SDL_SetTextureAlphaModFloat
SDL_SetTextureColorMod
1936{
1937 const float fA = (float)alpha / 255.0f;
1938
1939 return SDL_SetTextureAlphaModFloat(texture, fA);
1940}

SDL_GetTextureBlendMode
1985{
1986 SDL_Renderer *renderer;
1987
1988 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
1989
1990 if (blendMode == SDL_BLENDMODE_INVALID) {
1991 return SDL_InvalidParamError("blendMode");
1992 }
1993
1994 renderer = texture->renderer;
1995 if (!IsSupportedBlendMode(renderer, blendMode)) {
1996 return SDL_Unsupported();
1997 }
1998 texture->blendMode = blendMode;
1999 if (texture->native) {
2000 return SDL_SetTextureBlendMode(texture->native, blendMode);

◆ SDL_SetTextureColorMod()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_SetTextureColorMod ( SDL_Texture * texture,
Uint8 r,
Uint8 g,
Uint8 b )
extern

Set an additional color value multiplied into render copy operations.

When this texture is rendered, during the copy operation each source color channel is modulated by the appropriate color value according to the following formula:

srcC = srcC * (color / 255)

Color modulation is not always supported by the renderer; it will return false if color modulation is not supported.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
rthe red color value multiplied into copy operations.
gthe green color value multiplied into copy operations.
bthe blue color value multiplied into copy operations.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GetTextureColorMod

◆ SDL_UnlockTexture()

SDL_DECLSPEC void SDLCALL SDL_UnlockTexture ( SDL_Texture * texture)
extern

Unlock a texture, uploading the changes to video memory, if needed.

Warning: Please note that SDL_LockTexture() is intended to be write-only; it will not guarantee the previous contents of the texture will be provided. You must fully initialize any area of a texture that you lock before unlocking it, as the pixels might otherwise be uninitialized memory.

Which is to say: locking and immediately unlocking a texture can result in corrupted textures, depending on the renderer in use.

Parameters
texturea texture locked by SDL_LockTexture().
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_LockTexture
2544{
2545 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture,);
2546
2547 if (texture->access != SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING) {
2548 return;
2549 }
2550#ifdef SDL_HAVE_YUV
2551 if (texture->yuv) {
2552 SDL_UnlockTextureYUV(texture);
2553 } else
2554#endif
2555 if (texture->native) {
2556 SDL_UnlockTextureNative(texture);
2557 } else {
2558 SDL_Renderer *renderer = texture->renderer;
2559 renderer->UnlockTexture(renderer, texture);
2560 }
2561
2562 SDL_DestroySurface(texture->locked_surface);
2563 texture->locked_surface = NULL;
2564}
SDL_UnlockTextureNative

Definition SDL_render.c:2523

◆ SDL_UpdateNVTexture()

SDL_DECLSPEC bool SDLCALL SDL_UpdateNVTexture ( SDL_Texture * texture,
const SDL_Rect * rect,
const Uint8 * Yplane,
int Ypitch,
const Uint8 * UVplane,
int UVpitch )
extern

Update a rectangle within a planar NV12 or NV21 texture with new pixels.

You can use SDL_UpdateTexture() as long as your pixel data is a contiguous block of NV12/21 planes in the proper order, but this function is available if your pixel data is not contiguous.

Parameters
texturethe texture to update.
recta pointer to the rectangle of pixels to update, or NULL to update the entire texture.
Yplanethe raw pixel data for the Y plane.
Ypitchthe number of bytes between rows of pixel data for the Y plane.
UVplanethe raw pixel data for the UV plane.
UVpitchthe number of bytes between rows of pixel data for the UV plane.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
This function should only be called on the main thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_UpdateTexture
SDL_UpdateYUVTexture
2355{
2356#ifdef SDL_HAVE_YUV
2357 SDL_Renderer *renderer;
2358 SDL_Rect real_rect;
2359
2360 CHECK_TEXTURE_MAGIC(texture, false);
2361
2362 if (!Yplane) {
2363 return SDL_InvalidParamError("Yplane");
2364 }
2365 if (!Ypitch) {
2366 return SDL_InvalidParamError("Ypitch");
2367 }
2368 if (!UVplane) {
2369 return SDL_InvalidParamError("UVplane");
2370 }
2371 if (!UVpitch) {
2372 return SDL_InvalidParamError("UVpitch");
2373 }
2374
2375 if (texture->format != SDL_PIXELFORMAT_NV12 &&
2376 texture->format != SDL_PIXELFORMAT_NV21) {
2377 return SDL_SetError("Texture format must by NV12 or NV21");
2378 }
2379
2380 real_rect.x = 0;
2381 real_rect.y = 0;
2382 real_rect.w = texture->w;
2383 real_rect.h = texture->h;
2384 if (rect) {
2385 SDL_GetRectIntersection(rect, &real_rect, &real_rect);
2386 }
2387
2388 if (real_rect.w == 0 || real_rect.h == 0) {
2389 return true; // nothing to do.
2390 }
2391
2392 if (texture->yuv) {
2393 return SDL_UpdateTextureNVPlanar(texture, &real_rect, Yplane, Ypitch, UVplane, UVpitch);
2394 } else {
2395 SDL_assert(!texture->native);
2396 renderer = texture->renderer;
2397 SDL_assert(renderer->UpdateTextureNV);
2398 if (renderer->UpdateTextureNV) {
2399 if (!FlushRenderCommandsIfTextureNeeded(texture)) {
2400 return false;
2401 }
2402 return renderer->UpdateTextureNV(renderer, texture, &real_rect, Yplane, Ypitch, UVplane, UVpitch);
2403 } else {
2404 return SDL_Unsupported();
2405 }
2406 }
2407#else
2408 return false;
2409#endif
2410}
